title: Kylian Mbappé's French years come to a close
summary: Two days after officially announcing his departure from PSG, the striker bid farewell to the team's stadium during Sunday's game against Toulouse. From his early days with AS Monaco to his seven seasons with PSG, he has left his mark on French football history.

title: 'Stop this from getting out': Cohen implicates Trump in hush money case
summary: Donald Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen told jurors his client approved multiple large payouts in order to stifle stories, including to a Playboy model who alleged she and Trump had an extramarital affair.

title: North of Kharkiv, the Russian army has opened a new front
summary: Ukraine's General Staff acknowledged Russia had achieved 'tactical successes' around the country's second-largest city.

title: Chinese scientist who first published Covid-19 genome fights to reclaim lab
summary: On May 1, after spending three days outside, Zhang Yongzhen and his researchers were able to return to the laboratory.

title: 'Debt is the blind spot in the US presidential election'
summary: The IMF is concerned about the impact of the current large US fiscal imbalance on global financial stability. But neither Joe Biden nor Donald Trump seem ready to tackle the problem.

title: OpenAI launches new ChatGPT model with enhanced text, visual and audio features
summary: The new model GPT-4o will be rolled out in OpenAI's products over the next few weeks, the company said on Monday, with paid customers having unlimited access to the tool.

title: 7,000 French artists demand that streaming platforms pay them what they're owed
summary: These actors and soundtrack composers are calling for the implementation of a 2019 directive and want to be paid according to the success of the works they collaborate on.

title: Iranian director flees to Europe after prison sentence ahead of Cannes premiere
summary: Film-maker Mohammad Rasoulof  is currently in an undisclosed location, having fled Iran after being handed an eight-year sentence for 'making films and signing statements'.

title: 'First strike call at a US Apple Store: Big Tech's anti-union practices in the crosshairs'
summary: Unionized employees at one of the company's stores in Towson voted on Saturday to support a possible work stoppage, a first for the tech giant's US retail locations. However, unionization rates remain low in the country.

title: European elections: Macron's candidate says she was tricked into photo with 'neo-Nazi' group
summary: Valérie Hayer said activists from the neo-Nazi group set up a 'trap' for her, after a picture was shared of her next to a man wearing clothing with the slogan 'The White Race.'

title: Macron considers debating Le Pen to avoid European elections fiasco
summary: According to the president's supporters, such a face-off would illustrate the battle between 'nationalists and progressives' that they have sought to establish. Le Pen said she would not rule out taking part in a debate, but would prefer to hold it after the elections.

title: France announces record foreign investment at Choose France summit
summary: More than €15 billion in investments are set to be announced in Versailles on Monday, May 13, at this 'pro-business' forum, at which Macron gathered global business leaders.

title: Booking.com to face tough new EU competition rules
summary: The EU added the travel giant to the list of 'gatekeepers' that have to comply with the Digital Markets Act to ensure users have more options when choosing products.

title: Macron opposes TotalEnergies potential move to New York Stock Exchange
summary: The French multinational's CEO Patrick Pouyanne has floated the idea of making the move from the Paris CAC 40 index to New York.

title: French rugby legend Lucien Mias dies, aged 93
summary: Lucien Mias – nicknamed 'Doctor Pack' thanks to his other career – led France to their first Five Nations win in 1959.

title: German far-right AfD party once again defeated in courts
summary: The appeals case from the far-right Alternativ für Deutschland (AfD) party, challenging its classification by intelligence agency BfV as a 'suspected' right-wing extremist group, was rejected by the court, amid the party's many scandals ahead of the EU elections.

title: Armenia detains over 150 during protests against Azerbaijan land deal
summary: The demonstrators were protesting their government's territorial concessions to Azerbaijan, which began on April 23, with the historic process of demarcating the border between these two former Soviet republics.

title: Putin dismisses friend Sergei Shoigu and replaces him with economist as defense minister
summary: In a surprise move, Andrey Belousov, a civilian economist, was appointed Russia's defense minister, a move that's set to put the country's military at the center of its economy. Otherwise, the government reshuffle reveals a desire for stability.

title: Summit on Clean Cooking in Africa addresses women's climate issues
summary: The International Energy Agency is organizing a summit in Paris to put this neglected issue back at the top of the international agenda. It concerns almost a billion people on the continent.

title: European flag ban sparks discord at Eurovision
summary: For the 2024 edition, only the flags of participating states and the LGBTQ+ community were authorized, to avoid the presence of other symbols, including the Palestinian flag. The blue banner with gold stars paid the price, provoking incomprehension in Brussels.

title: New Caledonia announces curfew after riots over voting reforms
summary: Unrest erupted Monday in the French Pacific territory as protesters demonstrated against a constitutional reform being debated in the Assemblée Nationale in Paris which aims to expand the electorate in the territory's provincial elections.

title: #MeToo: 100 faces of the movement in France pose in historic photo
summary: One hundred public figures who have spoken out about sexual and gender-based violence have come together to pose for a historic photograph in Le Monde and co-sign an open letter calling for 'an all-encompassing law' on sexual violence.

title: Blinken makes unannounced visit to Ukraine to show US support
summary: The US secretary of state arrived in Kyiv Tuesday morning to reassure Ukraine of American support amid escalating Russian attacks.

title: Mbappé named France's Player of the Year
summary: The France captain won the Ligue 1 Best Player award at the UNFP Trophies gala for the fifth consecutive year. He confirmed last week he will leave PSG at the end of the season.

title: Indonesia rescue teams search in rivers as flash floods kill at least 50
summary: The search for survivors continued on Tuesday after flash floods hit Indonesia's Sumatra Island over the weekend. Almost 30 people are still reported missing.

title: Cannes 2024 opens in a year marked by #MeToo in French cinema
summary: The film festival kicks off on Tuesday, as more French actresses speak out about sexual assault and harassment in the industry.

title: AI: Anthropic launches ChatGPT rival 'Claude' in Europe
summary: The American company aims to distinguish itself from its competitors by introducing stricter safeguards.

title: French senators warn that France is 'submerged by drug trafficking'
summary: After six months of investigation, a report by a Sénat committee on drug trafficking published its conclusions on Tuesday, May 14. It presents a worrying assessment of the situation, along with proposals for reform.

title: French court set to rule in Polanski defamation trial
summary: British actress Charlotte Lewis has alleged the French-Polish filmmaker defamed her after she accused him of sexual abuse in the 1980s.

title: Modi files candidacy for seat in India election
summary: Cheering supporters waving saffron flags lined the streets of Varanasi on Monday, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived to rally votes .

title: US announces tariffs on $18 billion of China imports, including 100% on electric vehicles
summary: This was part of a series of tariff rises on $18 billion worth of Chinese imports that the White House announced on Tuesday.

title: At Trump's trial, Michael Cohen recounts his life as his boss's fixer
summary: A key witness for the prosecution, the lawyer spoke of the mechanisms put in place to protect the former president from revelations of his sexual adventures prior to the 2016 presidential election.

title: 'Megalopolis,' Francis Ford Coppola's latest gamble
summary: Forty-five years after his last Palme d'Or for 'Apocalypse Now,' the American director is back at the Cannes Film Festival with his new film in the official selection. The 85-year-old funded the movie himself, including with mortgages on his vineyards.
